concept_data.title: Intergovernmental Group of Twenty-four on International Monetary Affairs and Development

summary: The "Intergovernmental Group of Twenty-four on International Monetary Affairs and Development," commonly referred to as the "Group of Twenty-Four," is a significant entity within the realm of international monetary governance. Established to facilitate dialogue among developing countries on monetary and financial issues, this group plays a crucial role in shaping policies that affect global economic stability. In the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, the Group of Twenty-Four engages with EU institutions to advocate for the interests of its member states, particularly in discussions surrounding international financial architecture and development financing. This intergovernmental collaboration underscores the importance of inclusive dialogue in addressing global economic challenges.
